lines:
2 April 2009

Dr. K. 1. Kuk

Tiontain, China

My dear Sint -
Alls ne to acknowledge the receipt of you" very kind Letter of 
March 18th and the oneloped chook for Lite Hundred dollara Tor the account of 
your son. I an depositing the money to your boy's account, and will send you 
later an itemized list of expenditures

I appreciate very deeply your kind vords, and beg to assure you 
that it is a mai pleasure to be able to render over this slight aid to the 
Chinese boys who come to u trm such a great distance to secure the nåvantages 
of an American education. These boys in låter years will have great and most 
Important problems to solve, and it is a great responeltility that rests upon 
those who are callsa upon to assist them in profaring for the future,

Veży sincerely yours,

Principal

metadata.abstract: Letter acknowledging receipt of $500 for his son, Sung Sing Kwan's, account. He thanks Kwan for his kind words and says that he is pleased to render this slight aid to the students. It is important to educate them in light of the challenges they will face in the future.
